intro: Aizoon giessii, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a compact, mat-like growth habit with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Aizoon giessii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
